job description:
QA SME (Enrollment) – Lead QA

Location: Richmond, VA
Experience: 5+ years

About Us:

Clovity is a Microsoft Gold Partner, Atlassian Solution Partner and CIO's Top IoT Solution Provider, enabling global Fortune 500 enterprises and high growth mid-market technology enterprises with fully integrated device-to-cloud-to-enterprise integration solutions with the outcome to simplify building your Internet of Things (IoT), Data, Cloud & Digital platforms to power tomorrow’s Enterprise world.

Thinking "Agile | IoT | Embedded | Data | ML | AI | Cloud | DevOps | Digital" - Think Clovity as the Global Solutions Partner and Systems Integrator focused on transforming enterprises worldwide.

Clovity’s cognitive strength lies in the amalgamation of two powerful ideas - collaboration and transformity. Clovity emphasizes on combining thought leadership, innovation and passion for technology together to achieve successful transformation and 'disruptive solutions' for Banking Finance, Healthcare and Retail industries that are IoT, Cloud, Consumerization and Big Data' focused.

Preferred Skills/Background:
  • Experienced Healthcare Testing professional with Strong Technical knowledge in HealthCare ecosystem.
  • HealthCare Expert with product knowledge in Enrollment, Claims, Billing, and Reporting.
  • Experience in Groupers and Clinical Editing, Analytics, EDI, Digital Portals, Financials and Disbursement.
  • Senior QA leader with strong testing management skills responsible for communication and testing implementation with External & Internal stakeholders.
  • Managing all activities in the plan to ensure that all the objectives are met and that the solution works as expected.
  • Responsible for developing test plans, schedules, test cases, test automation frameworks, test
  • Execution planning, defect triage/management, partner coordination and test reporting
  • Maintaining external customer relations by interacting with clients
  • Establishes a repeatable Test Data Management Plan for Enrollment, Claims, and Billing areas
  • Track daily productivity
  • Expertise in testing Apache Camel ETL, Selenium, Informatica MDM, Nexidia Voice Analytics Tool, Recomind, Retail POS, JDA MMS and MSI Technology.
  • Integration testing (Batch & Real-time) involving SOAP, Rest API, TIBCO, Informatica Power Center, Informatica Cloud Services and BPEL
  • Experience in Informatica DVO, Jboss Developer Studio, Eclipse, Tortoise
  • Managed testing for Waterfall and Agile projects
  • Operating and Managing teams in onsite-offshore model
  • Experience Cloud Migrations specifically Azure

Salesforce Lead Developer (Senior)

Location: Newark, CA or San Jose, CA
Experience: 5+ years

About Us:

Clovity is a Microsoft Gold Partner, Atlassian Solution Partner and CIO's Top IoT Solution Provider, enabling global Fortune 500 enterprises and high growth mid-market technology enterprises with fully integrated device-to-cloud-to-enterprise integration solutions with the outcome to simplify building your Internet of Things (IoT), Data, Cloud & Digital platforms to power tomorrow’s Enterprise world.

Thinking "Agile | IoT | Embedded | Data | ML | AI | Cloud | DevOps | Digital" - Think Clovity as the Global Solutions Partner and Systems Integrator focused on transforming enterprises worldwide.

Clovity’s cognitive strength lies in the amalgamation of two powerful ideas - collaboration and transformity. Clovity emphasizes on combining thought leadership, innovation and passion for technology together to achieve successful transformation and 'disruptive solutions' for Banking Finance, Healthcare and Retail industries that are IoT, Cloud, Consumerization and Big Data' focused.

Preferred Skills/Background:
  • Candidate will be Salesforce development lead sitting onsite at our client
  • Experience in large custom development projects in an Enterprise Environment
  • Financialforce experience is highly valuable but not a "must have"
  • Solution Orientation: Find the source of tickets and develop ways to reduce or eliminate the issue through code solutions
  • Team Lead Salesforce Development Experience
  • Salesforce Development Certification
  • More Custom development background than working on Out of The Box Salesforce Functionality
  • Excellent writing and communication
  • Organizational and time management
  • Ability to ramp up in new environments quickly

Benefits:

  • Working with best-of-breed talent and client base in the country
  • A nurturing and caring environment which fosters learning
  • On-the-job learning opportunities.
  • Magnitude of recognition and growth opportunities

Data Scientist

Location: Minneapolis, MN
Experience: 5+ years

About Us:

Clovity is a Microsoft Gold Partner, Atlassian Solution Partner and CIO's Top IoT Solution Provider, enabling global Fortune 500 enterprises and high growth mid-market technology enterprises with fully integrated device-to-cloud-to-enterprise integration solutions with the outcome to simplify building your Internet of Things (IoT), Data, Cloud & Digital platforms to power tomorrow’s Enterprise world.

Thinking "Agile | IoT | Embedded | Data | ML | AI | Cloud | DevOps | Digital" - Think Clovity as the Global Solutions Partner and Systems Integrator focused on transforming enterprises worldwide.

Clovity’s cognitive strength lies in the amalgamation of two powerful ideas - collaboration and transformity. Clovity emphasizes on combining thought leadership, innovation and passion for technology together to achieve successful transformation and 'disruptive solutions' for Banking Finance, Healthcare and Retail industries that are IoT, Cloud, Consumerization and Big Data' focused.

Preferred Skills/Background:
  • Gathering and analyzing data, identifying key prediction/classification problems, devising solutions and building prototypes.
  • Formulating machine learning approaches while paying attention to business metrics, designing features from the rich data available from many sources, training, evaluating, and deploying models.
  • Researching and implementing methodologies to measure the impact of the technologies.
  • Initiating and proposing unique and promising modeling projects, developing new and innovative algorithms and technologies.
  • Developing high-performance algorithms for precision targeting, testing and implementing these algorithms.
  • Interacting with other teams to define interfaces and understanding and resolving dependencies.
  • At least 3 years of experience with Data Analysis, Predictive Analytics, or Machine Learning
  • At least 3 years of experience with at least one statistics/data analysis package, such as Python and R
  • At least 2 years of Bower BI and Tableau for Front End Reporting
  • 2-3 Years of experience working with Hadoop on the Data Layer
  • 1-2 years experience working with Teradata databases and technologies
  • Masters in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Math or related quantitative field preffered
Benefits:
  • Working with best-of-breed talent and client base in the country
  • A nurturing and caring environment which fosters learning
  • On-the-job learning opportunities.
  • Magnitude of recognition and growth opportunities
apply now JIRA Implementation Consultant

Location: Minneapolis, MN
Experience: 5+ years

About Us:

Clovity is a Microsoft Gold Partner, Atlassian Solution Partner and CIO's Top IoT Solution Provider, enabling global Fortune 500 enterprises and high growth mid-market technology enterprises with fully integrated device-to-cloud-to-enterprise integration solutions with the outcome to simplify building your Internet of Things (IoT), Data, Cloud & Digital platforms to power tomorrow’s Enterprise world.

Thinking "Agile | IoT | Embedded | Data | ML | AI | Cloud | DevOps | Digital" - Think Clovity as the Global Solutions Partner and Systems Integrator focused on transforming enterprises worldwide.

Clovity emphasizes on combining thought leadership, innovation and passion for technology together to achieve successful transformation and 'disruptive solutions' for Banking Finance, Healthcare and Retail industries that are IoT, Cloud, Consumerization and Big Data' focused.

Preferred Skills/Background:
  • Extensive hands-on experience with JIRA and Confluence configuration and knowledge on Bitbucket and Crowd.
  • Create complex JIRA workflows including project workflows, screen schemes, permission schemes, and notification schemes.
  • Perform business process analysis to determine how to implement processes in JIRA, including workflows, standardization, and agile development methodology.
  • Provide consultation, guidance, and recommendations for how the business process could change to maximize development tools implementation.
  • Provide end user coaching, training and support.
  • Extensive experience in project management and Agile scrum methodology
  • Has hands-on experience on Requirements Management, Bug tracking and Test case management tools
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills to be able to work with business users and document business process/requirements.
  • Strong analytical abilities, problem solving skills, and attention to detail
  • Solid understanding of troubleshooting and problem analysis procedures; ability to resolve problems quickly and efficiently
  • Experienced in Software development process, tools and training
  • Atlassian Certification Preffered or Equivalent Enterprise Experience
Benefits:
  • Working with best-of-breed talent and client base in the country
  • A nurturing and caring environment which fosters learning
  • On-the-job learning opportunities.

apply now Account Executive (Client Management)

Location: Minneapolis, MN; Richmond, VA; Detroit/Southfied, MI, Dallas/Plano, TX; Chicago IL
Experience: 2+ years

About Us:

Clovity is a Microsoft Gold Partner, Atlassian Solution Partner and CIO's Top IoT Solution Provider, enabling global Fortune 500 enterprises and high growth mid-market technology enterprises with fully integrated device-to-cloud-to-enterprise integration solutions with the outcome to simplify building your Internet of Things (IoT), Data, Cloud & Digital platforms to power tomorrow’s Enterprise world.

Thinking "Agile | IoT | Embedded | Data | ML | AI | Cloud | DevOps | Digital" - Think Clovity as the Global Solutions Partner and Systems Integrator focused on transforming enterprises worldwide.

Clovity’s cognitive strength lies in the amalgamation of two powerful ideas - collaboration and transformity. Clovity emphasizes on combining thought leadership, innovation and passion for technology together to achieve successful transformation and 'disruptive solutions' for Banking Finance, Healthcare and Retail industries that are IoT, Cloud, Consumerization and Big Data' focused.

Preferred Skills:

You will be part of a very energetic team which loves to work hard and play harder. At Clovity, you will interact with some of the biggest names in the Industry and will be calling them your client. The expectation is to engage with Clovity’s customers regularly and ensure their needs are met by coordinating internally. We at Clovity believe in an open culture, Always Be Learning attitude and continue to exchange ideas, so if you have one please sure to speak about it.

  • 2+ years of experience in an account management and/or business development role. Freshers may apply as well, as on-the-job training will be provided.
  • 1+ years of experience in technology sales and/or technology client management role or related roles is a plus.
  • Ability to nurture existing Clovity clients in the market area and expand our connection within the organizations
  • Business level understanding of current enterprise software, terminology, and its application at our client’s site.
  • Ability to facilitate collaboration between Clovity and IT Leadership/project stakeholders
  • Expand and curate new and existing relationships with IT and Development focused Executives.
  • Ability to recognize IT and development project potential while speaking with clients
  • Constantly adding to book of business through various business development strategies.
  • Able to wear many “hats” and contribute to the overall brand progress of Clovity
  • Travel to client sites as applicable based on distance/importance
  • Attend networking events weekly
  • Some out of state travel may be required
Background:
  • IT Services Recruiting background OR Administrative/Project-coordination background in IT Services are most welcome
  • Google Suite and Microsoft Office Suite proficiency
  • Aptitude on Social Media like LinkedIn, Twitter, and Facebook.
  • Excellent writing and communication
  • Organizational and time management
  • Ability to pick up new technologies utilized by Clovity in their business practice
  • Producing articles and posts to generate warm leads to Clovity.
Benefits:
  • Working with best-of-breed talent and client base in the country
  • A nurturing and caring environment which fosters learning
  • On-the-job learning opportunities.
  • Magnitude of recognition and growth opportunities
